definition: solid learning/real ability and learning/genuine talent
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

sentences.english: He's a young player with real quality.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個有真才實學的年輕球員。

sentences.english: With democracy, we can check whether legislators are knowledgeable.
sentences.chinese: 有民主，就可以考驗議員有沒有真才實學。
博士狀的蠢貨打壓着真才實學。

sentences.english: It is very difficult for children to truly admire their parents who have no genuine ability and learning.
sentences.chinese: 沒有真才實學的父母，很難讓孩子真正佩服。
他是位有真才實學的學者。

sentences.english: The five engineers of real learning are the mainstays of the small factory.
sentences.chinese: 那五位具有真才實學的工程師是這個小廠的中流砥柱。
有幾個真才實學的專家？

definition: rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
emotional state
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
historical materialism (Marx's theory of history)
pinyin: li4 shi3 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4

definition: to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
magnanimous
authority over the household
essay on policy in question and answer form used in imperial exams
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
equestrianism/horsemanship
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
druggist
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
